content.question: A block sits at rest on a horizontal surface where friction between the block and the surface is negligible. The block is placed in contact with an ideal spring, as shown. The block is pushed to the left so that the spring is compressed a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> from equilibrium and then the block is released from rest. Which of the following expressions describes the compression of the spring from equilibrium in terms of <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> at the moment the potential energy of the block-spring system is four times the kinetic energy of the block?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction the square root of 3, end root, over 2, end fraction, d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>d</mi></math>
<math alttext="the fraction 2, over the square root of 5, end fraction, d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mn>5</mn></msqrt></mfrac><mi>d</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 2, over the square root of 5, end fraction, d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mn>5</mn></msqrt></mfrac><mi>d</mi></math>
